items.title: Potential explosive device thrown into crowd at Perth Invasion Day rally, police say
items.description: Police say they are investigating whether a device thrown into an Invasion Day rally crowd in Perth contained explosives, in addition to ball bearings and screws found inside.

items.title: Trump sends 'border czar' to Minneapolis after shooting of nurse Alex Pretti
items.description: An American citizen, Alex Pretti, was shot by federal agents during a continuing Trump administration immigration crackdown in the city.

items.title: 'Heat dome' to shatter records as south-east soars to nearly 50C
items.description: A record heatwave across south-east Australia will peak during the coming days, leading to extreme fire danger and temperatures close to 50 degrees Celsius in multiple states.

items.title: Remains of last Israeli hostage in Gaza found, Netanyahu confirms
items.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu confirmed that the remains of 24-year-old Ran Gvili had been found and identified.

items.title: Government agency deliberately broke law for years, federal watchdog finds
items.description: Services Australia has known it was not fully complying with new child support laws since 2019, according to a scathing report released by the Commonwealth Ombudsman.

items.title: All top six seeds make quarterfinals for first time in the Open Era
items.description: The 2026 Australian Open will be the first grand slam that all top six seeds in the men's and women's singles have reached the quarterfinals in the Open Era.

items.title: Private jet crashes as major winter storm kills 13 across US
items.description: Almost 200 million Americans are under cold weather alerts as snow, sleet and freezing rain affects swathes of the country from Texas to New England, with temperatures set to fall dangerously low this week.

items.title: More than 1,100 properties told to evacuate near Vic Otways fire
items.description: Residents from more than 1,100 properties near Victoria's Otways bushfire have been asked to evacuate before sunset ahead of extreme fire conditions on Tuesday.

items.title: Russia, Ukraine and US plan further trilateral talks on ending war
items.description: Volodymyr Zelenskyy said discussions between envoys from Ukraine, Russia and the US in Abu Dhabi last week aimed at ending Moscow's invasion left some political issues unresolved.

items.title: Paying 'money just to breathe' in one the world's most polluted cities
items.description: Poor air quality in Delhi has impacted nearly all aspects of life with residents saying they have lost many of the "simple joys" such as opening a window or going for a walk outside.

items.title: Bystander videos show violent takedown before fatal shooting in Minneapolis
items.description: Multiple videos have emerged of nurse Alex Pretti before he was shot dead by federal agents in Minneapolis. The videos appear to contradict statements by the Trump administration, which said the shots were fired "defensively" against Mr Pretti as he "approached" authorities with a gun. In bystander videos, Mr Pretti is seen with only a phone in his hand, before US federal agents use pepper spray and wrestle him to the ground before opening fire.

items.title: A discreet intellectual network has been reshaping the world for 70 years. Here's how
items.description: A constant battle of ideas reshapes the world we live in, and few groups have been more successful in winning the war than the little-known Atlas Network.

items.title: Moderate Liberals 'rock solid' behind Sussan Ley amid leadership whispers
items.description: While conservatives Angus Taylor and Andrew Hastie canvass support to challenge for the Liberal leadership, moderates say there is no mood for turning on Sussan Ley — meaning a spill would likely result in another divided vote.

items.title: Traditional owners heartbroken by dingo cull after Piper James's death
items.description: The Queensland government euthanises six dingoes involved in Piper James's death on K'gari, and is expected to cull more in the coming days.

items.title: Elite marines among 42 people missing in Indonesian landslide
items.description: The search is ongoing for survivors after the pre-dawn landslide on the slopes of Mount Burangrang in West Java province killed at least two dozen people at the weekend.

items.title: Travellers stranded on Nullarbor as fire shuts Eyre Highway
items.description: A fire near Caiguna has blocked the major road link between Western Australia and the east coast.

items.title: Pub joey a story of the challenges facing country WA's 'underground' wildlife carers
items.description: Roofus is one of many orphaned kangaroos taken under the wing of unofficial wildlife carers, a vocation one Boddington local found in his adolescence.

items.title: Gold's record run rolls on as prices surge past $US5,000
items.description: Gold surges to a record high above $US5,000 an ounce, extending a historic rally as investors pile into the safe-haven asset amid rising geopolitical tensions.

items.title: The collateral damage from Trump's quest to deport immigrants
items.description: Minneapolis has become the flashpoint of an aggressive immigration enforcement operation ordered by the Trump administration and pitched as a campaign against undocumented criminals.

items.title: Rental deemed 'not habitable' by tribunal still being leased out
items.description: Furnished accommodation company ShareSorted was found in breach of its obligations related to at least two properties, but a lack of regulation allows them to continue to operate.

items.title: 'Gentle and kind': Tributes flow for Lake Cargelligo shooting victims
items.description: A pregnant woman who was one of three people shot dead in a suspected domestic violence attack in a remote NSW town has been remembered as a gentle and kind person.

items.title: I found a trove of letters from 1959. Their predictions were eerily familiar
items.description: I had been trawling absent-mindedly through the ABC's internal digital archive in a vague search for inspiration and clicked on this file called "Letters to the Unborn" at random.

items.title: Human remains found near Charters Towers belong to Jayden Penno-Tompsett
items.description: Human remains found in north Queensland belong to a missing New South Wales man last seen eight years ago, according to police.

items.title: Five quick and easy burger recipes for stress-free summer dinners
items.description: From chargrilled beef patties and beer-battered fish to vegetarian parmigiana and cheeseburger tray bake, we have burgers to suit all tastes and diets.

items.title: The 150 Indigenous kids who made a movie without Hollywood's permission
items.description: The beautifully animated, crowdsourced movie Imagine introduces a wealth of Indigenous knowledge to audiences in the funniest way possible and hopes to generate real change.
